result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernard G Rehor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with 15-CF-072.  Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 4/10/17 at 3:00 PM.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Kristina Konop appears by phone. Court reviews events in file, reviews memo from Agent Konop. Court questions Agent Konop on community service hours defendant has completed. Agent Konop indicates defendant hasn't completed any of the community service hours that she knows of nor has he paid anything toward his financial obligations. Defendant indicates he has back issues and hasn't been working, advises he's currently working toward getting on disability. Court indicates to defendant that he needs to get community service hours done. Court won't set another hearing, probation can request hearing if she feels one is needed.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense ready to proeed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Court dismisses 16-TR-77 tracking file but reads in for sentencing purposes. Defense asks court to set off sentencing for about 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Bernard G Rehor in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State has made a global offer to resolve all matter, Atty Gerbers asks court to set a plea date. Bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
